alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 1:04PM CST until February 11 at 4:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Period of Snow This Evening With Slick Travel... Snow moves in later this afternoon into the early evening, lasting 2-4 hours at any one location. Bulk accumulations will occur this evening with 2-4" possible from snowfall rates of 1/2 to 1" per hour. In the wake of the storm, patchy freezing drizzle could linger into the early morning hours. If traveling tonight, be prepared for wintry driving conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor County. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
